pros: Most people working there are awesome! Great team work and very kind hearts.
cons: Not enough recognition given to employees.

review_title: Responsible for exercise testing, taking blood pressures etc
pros: The experience is great. The patients are wonderful and very grateful for us
cons: We are overworked and underpaid.

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Miami, OK
pros: No pros can be identified
cons: PTO system is not good, no bonus system

review_title: A company that invests in the growth of their employees
pros: This Healthcare corporation is one of the few that is genuinely invested in the professional growth of their employees. I was with Baptist for 5 years, and in this time I went from clinical nutrition staff as a tray passer, to administrative partner, to Registered Nurse. I am so grateful for the investment Baptist made in enabling my growth within their organization.
cons: Management makes excuses or is permissive of poor performance from employees that have been there for a long time. They seem to value loyalty over performance.

pros: If you make no mistakes you will have a secure job, but forget about being passionate.
cons: If you are not in the click you will not be getting anything you work hard for.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Miami, FL
pros: Work schedule is mostly in your ball park, at least the floors I've worked in. They try to be flexible.
cons: Way too much charting, they micro-manage, constant chart reviews (daily) by administration, constant education weekly/monthly (and always mandatory) , monthly staff meetings (also mostly mandatory about 80% of the time), and you need to do a lot to increase your pay. 10% Pay increase is based on a point system (CCAP) not the floor you work, yearly raises are based on your work, about 1-1.5%, and they rarely give you the points to bring it above that percent. Also, you can only apply for the point based system after 3 years of working as a nurse.

pros: The staff are kind and respectful.
cons: There is a lot of micromanagement within the hospital.

pros: They match you up to 2% of your salary for retirement.
cons: They expect the world from you but won’t bend in return for you.

review_title: Not what is expected from a cancer center
pros: Good financial resources and staff support for a new leaders. New cancer center building that is clean.
cons: Poor leadership that lacks oncology care understanding. They lack leadership skills but likely stems from the clinical understanding of the oncology departments. Staff morale is low from the fear of retaliation for having their own ideas or questioning that of senior leadership. Lacks empowerment and creative of its experienced staff members.

pros: Great people and very helpful coworkers
cons: Too much walking the hospital is huge

job_title: Physician Assistant, PA-C in Miami, FL
pros: it offers good benefits, no calls or weekends.
cons: management does micro management. Holidays, vacation time and sick time is all included in PTO

pros: Good working Culture. Always professional
cons: Long Commute time. Need pay raise.

pros: Easy job. Good employees. Love the patients
cons: Can be hard on the back

pros: Stimulating work place and interesting work.

pros: Wonderful coworkers, friendly and helpful atmosphere. Large organization means there is a lot of opportunity for advancement or transfer.  Work-life balance is encouraged by most managers. I love it here!
cons: Antiquated IT policies, old school approach to finance (no electronic expense forms, no direct deposit of expenses.) A few managers seem to fear flexible work policies like telecommuting or flex time, though most do try to accommodate staff as much as possible.

pros: Good benefits , Good people, Diversed population, Nice working environment, Top 14 in Fortune's best companies. In my few years of working here, I have met good people and friends. They always care for each one. And you can be recognized for the good work that you do.
cons: You have to step ahead of the game so you can be heard and advance in your area of work.

pros: Baptist is very pro employees and is all about quality.  There was always stability and job security at this company. Nowadays we hear a lot of " be happy you have a job, we get over 1000 applicants per week..
cons: Leadership is not the best. It's hard to move up. Currently they are cutting expenses so a lot of benefits we previously had are going away.  Copayments on insurance have had a significant increase.

pros: It's a pretty place to work
cons: Many people are leaving and thus we are extremely short staffed. Overworked and underpaid.

pros: Image is great. Community is great. Very nice buildings. Lots of training and education. Once your in, you have lots of opportunity available to you.
cons: Managers in general for various floors are poorly received. Some floors are great to work on while others most people hate. The jobs with the highest turn over are those bad floors but easiest to get into.

review_title: Cutting edge technology in a intense learning environment
pros:
Great benefits
Beautiful location
They provide employees with the necessary materials so we can do a good job
cons:
Pays under the average rate (both salaried and per diem)
Staff is overbooked with patients on a daily basis making it overwhelming and stressful

pros: good pay and benefits. Allow to work individually one demonstrate that you do the job. Low turn over for most of the departments. Can be a good place to retire from. If you are heading to an interview questions are mostly PBI, and make sure you are authentic.
cons: Time off. Can be a challenge if your a single mother.

pros: Great people great benefits great physicians.
cons: imaging has changed in a  negative way.  Not a pro employee environment

review_title: Great Hospital, great staff, but difficult to move up the ladder without knowing someone high up.
pros: Team centered atmosphere and a genuine goal to advocate for the patient.
cons: Hard work doesn't always pay off, knowing the right people does.

pros: Facility, coworkers and flexible scheduling
